column1: Kuzminki District (Russian: райо́н Кузьми́нки) is a district of South-Eastern Administrative Okrug of the federal city of Moscow
The main point of interest in the district is the Vlakhernskoye-Kuzminki
column2: a former estate of the Stroganov and Golitsyn families. In the 17th century
column3: the territory of the modern district belonged to the Simon monastery. In 1702
column4: Peter the Great gave this land to Grigory Dmitriyevich Stroganov.

column1: Two Moscow Metro stations are located in the district: Kuzminki and Volzhskaya.
